definition: to ask for sky-high prices
free/unrestrained/to inundate
day/sky/heaven
to demand/to request/to coerce
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
great/good/middleman/servant
price/value/(chemistry) valence

sentences.english: That seaside hotel charges exorbitant prices during the summer holidays.
sentences.chinese: 那家海滨旅馆在夏天休假期间漫天要价。

sentences.english: They tried to overcharge me, but I didn't agree.
sentences.chinese: 他们企图向我漫天要价，但我没同意。

sentences.english: I am not eating luxurious dishes without nutrition.
sentences.chinese: 我不吃没有营养又漫天要价的那些垃圾食品。

sentences.english: Some vendors hoodwink outside tourists by charging them exorbitant prices.
sentences.chinese: 有的小贩漫天要价，坑骗外地游客。

sentences.english: They priced themselves out of the world market.
sentences.chinese: 他们由于漫天要价而把自己赶出了世界市场。

sentences.english: The rooms are small, the service is surly and they're overpriced.
sentences.chinese: 房间小，服务态度差，还漫天要价。

sentences.english: The businessman had gone too far in raising the market upon Mike.
sentences.chinese: 这商人向迈克漫天要价也太没个谱了。

sentences.english: My offer were based on reasonable profit, not on wild speculations.
sentences.chinese: 我的报价以符合逻辑利润为依据，否则漫天要价。

sentences.english: It's daylight robbery to charge 60 pence for a cup of tea.
sentences.chinese: 一杯茶卖60便士，简直是漫天要价。

definition: to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
extortion by taking advantage of sb's weakness
asking price/to ask a price/to demand terms (in negotiations)
to make a counteroffer when haggling/to bargain
to break a promise/breach of contract
to negotiate (prices)/to haggle
to artificially inflate/to bid up (the price)
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
can't come to an agreement
to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
to quote a price/seller's first offer
to haggle over price/to bargain
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to renege on a debt
to overcharge/to rip sb off
